The Game Awards 2018 announcements: Dragon Age 4 and Far Cry: New Dawn headline new game reveals  The Telegraph

BioWare has announced that RPG Dragon Age 4 is coming at The Game Awards ceremony. The long-awaited fantasy RPG is reportedly still early in development, but BioWare has teased its fans with a short video and the phrase The Dread Wolf Rises; a reference to elven apostate Solas. item.title: What to expect from Anthem as Bioware announce alpha test for shared world shooter - The Telegraph
item.description:
What to expect from Anthem as Bioware announce alpha test for shared world shooter  The Telegraph

It can be a shock to the system when a game developer deviates from the type of games it has built its name on. Bioware, so famed for its sprawling story-based single-player role-playing games, is doing just that with Anthem. Broadly billed as publisher EA's answer to Destiny, Anthem is a shared-world multiplayer shooter in which you play as a 'freelancer', a super-soldier packed into a Javelin exosuit, sent to complete missions and gather loot in its ornate sci-fi fantasy world. item.description:
'Horizon Zero Dawn' Is Beautiful And Tedious  Forbes Now

Credit: Sony I can’t shake this feeling, deep inside of me. As gorgeous as Horizon Zero Dawn truly is, that doesn’t mean it’s particularly fun or interesting. After my initial letdown with the game, I kept hoping I’d start to like it more as I journeyed further in. But most of my enjoyment is coming from the visuals, which are striking to say the least. item.description:
Even After 5 Years In Development, 'Mass Effect: Andromeda' Feels Rushed  Forbes Now

Maybe ‘Mass Effect: Andromeda’ needed more time in the oven. In my time with Mass Effect: Andromeda so far I’ve encountered a litany of bugs, glitches and other issues. item.description:

item.description:
EA's 'Anthem' Delay Could Save BioWare From The Sad Fate Of 'Titanfall 2'  Forbes Now

A delayed ‘Anthem’ could save BioWare. EA is moving the release date of its upcoming BioWare space shooter Anthem to early 2019. That’s a smart decision, and one that gamers and BioWare fans should applaud. While the move had been rumored already, EA made the announcement official in its earnings report.
